events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle on Main Street during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords such as vehicle, collision, and accident in the initial report.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case promptly and ensure proper follow-up.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the insured of next steps.
The customer was asked to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and statements from witnesses.
All requested documents including detailed photos and official police report were submitted by the customer on time.
The investigation into the accident details and liability began with assigned adjusters reviewing submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault; all evidence was carefully analyzed and verified.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover the full costs of vehicle repairs following the accident assessment.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and settlement proposal after the accident claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after confirming all investigation findings and documents.
The settlement payment was issued electronically to the customer's account to cover repair costs of the vehicle.
The auto accident claim was closed after successful payment and confirmation of repair completion by the insured.
All case files and records related to the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference.
